Description: Papyrus fragment of a loan agreement: on one side the first 6 lines of this Coptic text are preserved, written along the fibres; on the other a 2-line docket in Greek is imperfectly preserved in a different hand. An account was written later on the same side as the docket, written along the fibres, involving 18 lines of men's names. The papyrus is crumpled and many fibres are partially detached. Mounted with EA 75331, 75330.
Curator's comments: Provenance: this text was issued by people from the Hermopolite village named Migdol (of) the Four Villages to a monk of the Monastery of Apa Apollo. Migdol (of) the Four Villages may have had connections with Bawit.
Bibliographic references: Clackson 2000 / Coptic and Greek Texts relating to the Hermopolite Monastery of Apa Apollo (p.12, 98-9, pl.20)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (86587) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/86587)
Associated places: Named in inscription: Monastery of Apa Apollo
